page.title: 13TAKING HOME PEATS
page.content: The peats have to be taken off the banks by tractor and trailer to the road where they are often dumped off while the tractor goes back on to the soft moss for another load. Once it comes back, the unloaded peats are carefully stacked back on, and the bigger, topped up load, goes off down the road to the house. Even then the work isn't finished as the peats have to be stacked carefully. If you don't stack them they will be soaked in the long wet winter, and all your work will have been in vain.
